revised_title: Determining the Length of a Degree of Latitude in North America
tldr: This article describes the efforts of Charles Mason, Jeremiah Dixon, and Nevil Maskelyne to determine the length of a degree of latitude in the provinces of Maryland and Pennsylvania in North America. They used an excellent sector to trace out a parallel of latitude and made astronomical observations at both ends of the lines. The method they used was capable of great exactness, and their measure of a degree is considered valuable for further research on the figure of the earth.
